definition: to go into mourning for one's parents
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: If everyone keeps in line, we'll get through the Customs more quickly.
sentences.chinese: 要是大家都守制序，咱們會很快通過海關的。

definition: to observe mourning for one's parents
to keep watch beside a coffin/to observe a period of mourning
to retire from a government post (old)
to dismiss from office/to resign from office
to request permission to resign from an official position (old)
to take up an official post
to hasten home for the funeral of a parent or grandparent
(literary) to be in mourning after the death of a parent
